item.title: By: Pedro Fernandes
item.dc:creator: Pedro Fernandes
item.description: Small economies, with an only modest investment in science, are in dire straits. The National funding agency cannot afford Plan-S. Grants would stop. Instead, we carry-on with our consortia around "b-on" and pay subscriptions in bulk. The funding agency orchestrates. Researchers have lost the power to negotiate except for things like discounts in APCs. The contract with b-on is exclusive for 5 years. With this, plan-S will not include Portugal for quite some time, and publishers do not see b-on as a tough negotiator.
item.content:encoded: Small economies, with an only modest investment in science, are in dire straits. The National funding agency cannot afford Plan-S. Grants would stop. Instead, we carry-on with our consortia around “b-on” and pay subscriptions in bulk. The funding agency orchestrates. Researchers have lost the power to negotiate except for things like discounts in APCs. The contract with b-on is exclusive for 5 years. With this, plan-S will not include Portugal for quite some time, and publishers do not see b-on as a tough negotiator.

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/reflections-on-plan-s/#comment-3097">protohedgehog</a>.
Thanks, Toma! Wanted to try and write something that hadn't been done yet, and that hopefully others will find useful in understanding more of the debate. I expect the future to be just as interesting/complex too :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to protohedgehog.

Thanks, Toma! Wanted to try and write something that hadn’t been done yet, and that hopefully others will find useful in understanding more of the debate. I expect the future to be just as interesting/complex too ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/reflections-on-plan-s/#comment-3096">Toma Susi</a>.
Good call. And yes, that was a nice post from them. Have simply deleted that last sentence now. Thanks!

In reply to Toma Susi.

Good call. And yes, that was a nice post from them. Have simply deleted that last sentence now. Thanks!

item.title: By: Toma Susi
item.dc:creator: Toma Susi
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/reflections-on-plan-s/#comment-3095">protohedgehog</a>.
Hmmh. I think you may need to finesse this a bit more for the point to come across, the end sounds like you are only blaming the backers for vested interests. And perhaps the response to PNAS by Kiley and Smits is at least partly in line with what you are calling for: https://www.pnas.org/content/early/2019/03/01/1902136116.full
item.content:encoded:
In reply to protohedgehog.

Hmmh. I think you may need to finesse this a bit more for the point to come across, the end sounds like you are only blaming the backers for vested interests. And perhaps the response to PNAS by Kiley and Smits is at least partly in line with what you are calling for:
https://www.pnas.org/content/early/2019/03/01/1902136116.full

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/reflections-on-plan-s/#comment-3094">Toma Susi</a>.
Firstly, thank you for reading to the end, Toma! Much appreciated.
I do mean those who back it, so Science Europe, RJS et al. For example, are they going to continue to let private interests erode scholarship and suck money from the public purse? Or will they simply say enough is enough, and they are going to invest in a non-profit scholarly infrastructure. I don't expect them to clearly answer this, but actions speak louder than words :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Toma Susi.

Firstly, thank you for reading to the end, Toma! Much appreciated.

I do mean those who back it, so Science Europe, RJS et al. For example, are they going to continue to let private interests erode scholarship and suck money from the public purse? Or will they simply say enough is enough, and they are going to invest in a non-profit scholarly infrastructure. I don’t expect them to clearly answer this, but actions speak louder than words ðŸ™‚
